723751f.text:
107 Varick Street, adjoining the S.W. corner of Broome Street. This is one of the houses in the block demolished in the 1920's
for the Holland Tunnel Entrance Plaza.
June 11, 1914.
Vh;rta Rrothers.
723751f.folder: Varick Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

717887f-a.text:
Church of our Lady of Vilna, 570 Broome Street, adjoining the
N. W. corner of Varick.
September 27,1927.
P. L. Sperr.
717887f-a.folder: Broome Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

723750f-a.text:
Varick Street, west side, south from Broome Street, showing in the foreground the Holland Tunnel Plaza. This was taken shortly after the opening of the tunnel, and about a year before the demolition of the old houses on the south or Watts Street side of
the Plaza.
February 12, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
723750f-a.folder: Varick Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

723749f-a.text:
Holland Tunnel Plaza, Varick Street, west side, from Broome to Watts Streets, showing vehicles headed for the entrance to
the tunnel.
February 12, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
723749f-a.folder: Varick Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

717886f-a.text:
558, 556 and 554 Broome Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Varick Street (foreground), as viewed across a gas station at the S.E. corner. The five story stable adioinlng the corner structure (which also bears No. 110-112 Varick Street)
is No. 556 Broome Street.
Nov. 9, 1930
L. Sperr
717886f-a.folder: Broome Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

717888f-a.text:
Holland Tunnel Plaza, Broome Street, north side, from Varick
Street to Hudson.
June 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
717888f-a.folder: Broome Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

717889f-b.text:
Broome Street, north side, between Varick and Hudson Streets. Officials of the New York Port Authority, City of New York and the State of New Jersey at the Manhattan mouth of the completed Holland Tunnel. The photoarapher is viewing southward from inside of same and shows in the background the later demolished 2 1/2 story buildings on
the south side of Broome Street.
Spring 1927.
The toll gates outside of the tunnel entrance.
1936
W. P. A. photo
Federal Writers Project
Credit Line Imperative
717889f-b.folder: Broome Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

717890f-a.text:
Broome Street, north side, between Varick and Hudson Streets, showing three distinct stages of the Holland Tunnel entrance. The photographer is viewing northward in all instances. Note in No. 3 the office structure that replaced teneients to the west of the adit. This is the Boarc of Transportation Build. ing occupying tne frontage on the east side of Hudson from Broome
to Dominick Street's.
View 1: Oct. 10, 1927
View 2: Dec. 7, 1927
L. Sperr
W. P. A. Photo
Federal Workers Project  View 3:  1936

717891f-a.text:
(1)
Broome Street, north side, from No. 586, east of Hudson Street, to Varick Street, showing she entrance to the Holland Vehicular Tunnel and the original ticket booths, shortly after the opening
of the tunnel.
December 7, 1927.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The same,nearly a year later, after demolition of the buildings
between Hudson Street and the Tunnel entrance.
October 11,1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, at a later date. Also shown (left) is Hudson Street, north from and iweindire Bronme to Vanda Streets witw tbe 9-story building of the Henry Heide Candy Manufacturing Co. occupying the
block from Spring to Vandam Streets.
February 20, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
